lines.text: So far so good.
It wasn't so far. We just came across the street.
Well, you see, Ollie and I are sorry for what happened this afternoon, and just to show you that we're not mad at you, we brought you a little Christmas present. From me and from Ollie.

[incredulously]
A Christmas present in the middle of July?
Oh, oh, yes, you see, we always do our Christmas shopping early.

[showing off one of the toy soldiers built for Santa's order]
Isn't it wonderful? It does everything but talk.
Wonderful, yes. But not what I ordered.
What do you mean?
I ordered 600 soldiers at 1 foot high.
What?

[to Stannie]
You took that order. What was it?
I thought you said 100 soldiers six feet high.
Goodbye Stannie.
Well aren't I going with you?
Why no. You've got to stay here with Barnaby. You're married to him.

[starting to cry]
I don't want to stay here with him.
Why not?
I don't love him.
[blubbers]
Big bait catches big rat!

[Bo Peep is being forced to marry Barnaby]
Stannie's so upset he isn't even going to the wedding. You're upset aren't you Stannie?
Upset? I'm housebroken!
Not housebroken!

[to Bo Peep]
He means 'heartbroken'

[scoffs]
Housebroken.
[Stannie nibbles on pig sausage evidence]
It doesn't taste like pig sausage to me.
What does it taste like?
It tastes like pork. Try it.

[takes a bite]
Why that's neither pig nor pork. It's beef.
Beef?
I smell a rat.
[smells the sausage]
Barnaby's got a hand in that.
[starts examining the sausage]

[Barnaby flees after it's revealed he was responsible for kidnapping Elmer and framing Tom Tom]
I'll give 50,000 guinneas for the capture of that scoundrel, dead or alive.
Dead or alive?
Dead or alive!
Can't you make up your mind how you want him?
[Barnaby disappears down well. Stannie and Ollie corner him]
You better come up dead or alive!
Now, how can he come up dead when he's alive?
Let's drop a rock on him. That'll make him dead when he's alive.
Now you're talkin' sense.

[into well]
Look out!
*Don't* tell him to look out!
Well, it might'a hit 'im.
That's what we *want* it to do!

[into well]
Did it hit ya?
Not a sound.
It musta got 'im.
Why should you worry? You and he are just like THAT.
But that was before we were married.
Her talking to Barnaby is a matter of pouring one ear into the other. Can't be done.
Me and The Toymaker are just like that!
[crosses his fingers for emphasis]

[looking at Ollie's crossed fingers]
Which one's you?

[Ollie takes a note from the money purse and tries to read. Stan turns it right-side-up. The note says "I.O.U $1.47']
I borrowed it.
I know you borrowed it. What I want to know is, what did you borrow it for?
Well, I lost all me pee-wees playing with Little Jack Horner, and I had to get some more.

[Disgustedly to Stannie, as they are locked into the foot stocks]
Good night, Ollie. *Mmmm*
Hey, Ollie, when you ask the Toymaker for the money, will you get a little extra for me?
What for?
Well I, I lost me peewee...

[the dunking chair breaks and Ollie is stuck under water]
Hurry. He'll die of ammonia!
Now, you may kiss the bride.
[lifts the veil to reveal Stannie, not Bo Peep. Barnaby looks shocked. Ollie bursts out laughing]
What's the meaning of this?
Big bait catches big rat.
The king shall hear of this!
You may go.
Thank you, sir.
Does that mean we're free?
Yes. From now on, you and I are going to be very close friends.

[disappointed; indicates to Stannie]
Does that mean he doesn't have to be dunked?
Yes.
Isn't that nice?
What?
He and I are just like *that*. And I don't have to get wet.
Oh, is that so?
[shoves Stannie into the pond]
Now, ya see, if you hadn't said, "good night, Ollie", this wouldn't have happened.
What's all the commotion out here? Have you no reverence for my beauty sleep?
